summary: The bill, the Ensuring Accurate and Complete Abortion Data Reporting Act of 2025, mandates improved reporting of abortion data to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). It amends the Social Security Act and Public Health Service Act to require states to submit abortion data as a condition for receiving federal funding for family planning services. The bill specifies the data to be collected, including maternal age, gestational age, race, ethnicity, and abortion method. It directs the CDC to create a standardized data collection system, provide technical assistance to states, and issue annual reports on abortion data.
